title: How to Make Baked Pears

methods.name: Making Pears with Walnuts and Honey

steps.headline: Prepare the pears.
steps.description: Using a baking sheet or cutting board, cut your pears in half. From there, use a round spoon or melon baller to remove the seeds and cores. All your pears should have a small hole in the center. You should also slice off the ends of the pears to remove the stems and cores.

steps.headline: Season the pears.
steps.description: To season, place your pears on a baking sheet. Sprinkle your cinnamon over your pears first. Then, top the pears off with some walnuts. Apply the honey by drizzling it over the pears.

steps.headline: Bake the pears.
steps.description: The pears should be baked at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (approximately 177 degrees Celsius). You should bake the pears for 30 minutes. Allow the pears to cool to the touch before serving.

steps.headline: Prepare your pears.
steps.description: Set your pears on a cutting board. Cut them all in half. From there, scoop out the seeds. You should be left with halved pears with a small hole in the center, resembling avocados.

steps.headline: Season the pears with cinnamon.
steps.description: Place your pears on a baking sheet with the inside of the pears facing upwards. Sprinkle your cinnamon evenly over the pears.

steps.headline: Whisk the maple syrup and vanilla.
steps.description: Place your maple syrup and vanilla in a small mixing bowl. Use a wire whisk to whisk these ingredients together. Keep stirring until you have an even mixture.

steps.headline: Drizzle the maple syrup mixture over the pears.
steps.description: Take your maple syrup mixture. Slowly drizzle it over your pears, leaving about 2 tablespoons of the mixture in the bowl. Make sure you get an even amount on all of your pears.

steps.headline: Bake the pears.
steps.description: You should bake your pears at 375 degrees Fahrenheit (approximately 190 degrees Celsius). The pears should bake for about 25 minutes. After you remove your pears from the oven, drizzle the remaining maple syrup mixture over them. Allow the pears to cool slightly before serving them.

methods.name: Making Pears with Brown Sugar and Vanilla Ice Cream

steps.headline: Arrange the pears.
steps.description: Cut your pears in half and remove the seeds with a spoon. Place them face up on a baking dish. Use an 8-inch square baking dish to bake your pears.

steps.headline: Whisk the apple juice and sugar.
steps.description: Place your apple juice and sugar in a sauce pan. Place the pan over medium heat. Use a wire whisk to vigorously whisk the ingredients together. Keep stirring the mixture until the sugar completely dissolves.

steps.headline: Add the butter.
steps.description: Once the sugar is dissolved, add the butter. Whisk the butter into the apple juice mixture until everything is mixed evenly.

steps.headline: Pour your sauce over the pears.
steps.description: Drizzle the sauce you made over your pears. Make sure to drizzle it evenly over all the pears before putting the pears in the oven.

steps.headline: Bake your pears.
steps.description: The pears should bake at 400 degrees Fahrenheit (about 205 degrees Celsius). They should bake for about 35 minutes. When the pears are done, they will be just beginning to brown.

steps.headline: Serve with vanilla ice cream.
steps.description: Allow the pears to cool for a few minutes. Then, spoon them onto individual plates. Serve the pears with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

Place your pears on a baking sheet with the inside of the pears facing upwards. Sprinkle your cinnamon evenly over the pears. Whisk the maple syrup and vanilla. Place your maple syrup and vanilla in a small mixing bowl. Use a wire whisk to whisk these ingredients together. Keep stirring until you have an even mixture. Drizzle the maple syrup mixture over the pears. Take your maple syrup mixture. Slowly drizzle it over your pears, leaving about 2 tablespoons of the mixture in the bowl. Make sure you get an even amount on all of your pears. Bake the pears. You should bake your pears at 375 degrees Fahrenheit (approximately 190 degrees Celsius). The pears should bake for about 25 minutes. After you remove your pears from the oven, drizzle the remaining maple syrup mixture over them. Allow the pears to cool slightly before serving them. Making Pears with Brown Sugar and Vanilla Ice Cream Arrange the pears. Cut your pears in half and remove the seeds with a spoon. Place them face up on a baking dish. Use an 8-inch square baking dish to bake your pears. Whisk the apple juice and sugar. Place your apple juice and sugar in a sauce pan. Place the pan over medium heat. Use a wire whisk to vigorously whisk the ingredients together. Keep stirring the mixture until the sugar completely dissolves. Add the butter. Once the sugar is dissolved, add the butter. Whisk the butter into the apple juice mixture until everything is mixed evenly. Pour your sauce over the pears. Drizzle the sauce you made over your pears. Make sure to drizzle it evenly over all the pears before putting the pears in the oven. Bake your pears. The pears should bake at 400 degrees Fahrenheit (about 205 degrees Celsius). They should bake for about 35 minutes. When the pears are done, they will be just beginning to brown. Serve with vanilla ice cream. Allow the pears to cool for a few minutes. Then, spoon them onto individual plates. Serve the pears with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
